p: Supplementary healthcare services also present problems, involving increasingly higher financial payments, with often abusive adjustments of prices, without, however, providing services that correspond to the increase in monthly fees. Additionally, there are frauds, an excessive number of exams, and unnecessary procedures. At the same time, health workers, especially non-physicians, are dissatisfied with salaries that do not keep up with inflation, undersized staff, pressure, and increased demand for productivity and the need to meet increasingly higher goals ( 4) .
